intro: Ageratina maranonii, commonly known as the Maranon blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Ageratina maranonii plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing nectar for pollinators.
